title: Gazans Are Dying of Starvation
summary: After 21 months of devastating conflict with Israel, Gaza’s most vulnerable civilians — the young, the old and the sick — are facing what aid groups say is impending famine.

title: As Starvation Rises, Israeli Minister Says Israel Is ‘Driving Out’ Gazans
summary: Amichay Eliyahu’s comments came amid growing hunger in the territory, where Israel controls the delivery of food.

title: Venezuelan Migrant Takes First Step Toward Suing the U.S. Over Detention in El Salvador
summary: Neiyerver Adrián Leon Rengel, who was held in a prison in El Salvador, filed a claim Thursday against Homeland Security, accusing it of wrongful detention.

title: Amy Sherald Cancels Her Smithsonian Show, Citing Censorship
summary: The artist said that she made the decision after she said she learned that her painting of a transgender Statue of Liberty might be removed to avoid provoking President Trump.

title: What Happens When Your Therapist Falls Ill or Dies Unexpectedly?
summary: Therapists are cautious about sharing personal information. When they fall ill or die unexpectedly, the shock can be shattering.

title: Josh Shapiro Says Zohran Mamdani Fails to Condemn ‘Blatantly Antisemitic’ Rhetoric
summary: Two top Jewish Democrats, Gov. Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania and former Mayor Rahm Emanuel of Chicago, criticized Mr. Mamdani for not condemning those who use the slogan “globalize the intifada.”

title: Michael Whatley, R.N.C. Chairman, to Run for Senate in North Carolina
summary: His entry will pave the way for a marquee contest in 2026, with former Gov. Roy Cooper planning to seek the Democratic nomination.

title: Tony Evers Declines to Run for 3rd Term as Wisconsin Governor
summary: The decision is likely to invite a wide-open race for the Democratic nomination in a battleground state the party hopes to control.

title: Anne Burrell’s Cause of Death Ruled a Suicide
summary: The Food Network star was found dead in her apartment on June 17.

title: Appeals Court Blocks California’s Background Checks for Ammunition Buyers
summary: The law violates the Second Amendment, a panel of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit ruled in a 2-1 decision.

title: Europe Nears U.S. Trade Deal, but Stands Ready to Retaliate
summary: Nearly every member of the European Union supports a plan to hit back against President Trump’s tariffs if no agreement is reached.

title: Elon Musk Sees ‘Rough’ Times Ahead for Tesla
summary: Shares in Tesla were down in premarket trading as the carmaker lays out the risks from President Trump’s tariffs and his scrapping of tax credits.

title: How to Host a Hamptons Gala for the Super-Rich
summary: Facing federal funding cuts, the Parrish Art Museum is among the institutions increasingly relying on elaborate parties to lure the nation’s elites to pitch in.

title: What to Know About the Thailand-Cambodia Clash
summary: The countries traded fire on Thursday, and Thailand said at least 12 people had been killed. Cambodia did not immediately comment on any casualties.

title: Christian Cancel Culture Strikes Again
summary: Chip and Joanna Gaines had the temerity to feature a gay couple on their new show.

title: What’s in a Name?
summary: All politicians try to play the frame game. President Trump is a master at it.

title: What Are the Viral Moments You Remember Most From the Last Decade?
summary: Virality has changed over the years. Tell us about your experiences online in an earlier internet age.

title: After Surge During Pandemic, Homicides Fall Significantly
summary: An analysis released Thursday by the Council on Criminal Justice shows that the majority of crimes the council tracks are continuing to decrease in 42 U.S. cities.

title: A Series of Mysterious Explosions Unnerves Syrians
summary: Many of the blasts, some of them deadly, have been at weapons storage sites, raising questions about whether ordnance from Syria’s civil war has been properly secured.

title: Prosecutor Fired by Trump Officials Defiantly Says She Is Set to Take Job
summary: Desiree Grace, in a social media post, said she was prepared to follow a judicial order and take over as U.S. attorney in New Jersey “in accordance with the law.”

title: Children Burned by Plane Crash in Bangladesh Die Days Later
summary: Many have died in the days since a plane crashed into a school in Bangladesh. For the survivors, there is a critical window for lifesaving treatment.
